trans-unit.source: Frame rate counters
trans-unit.target: Frame rate counters

trans-unit.source: Use the frame rate counters in Windows Phone emulator to monitor the performance of your running app.
trans-unit.target: Use the frame rate counters in Windows Phone emulator to monitor the performance of your running app.

trans-unit.source: Frame rate counters in Windows Phone emulator
trans-unit.target: Frame rate counters in Windows Phone emulator

trans-unit.source: Descriptions of the frame rate counters
trans-unit.target: Descriptions of the frame rate counters

trans-unit.source: The following table describes each frame rate counter.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes each frame rate counter.

trans-unit.source: Frame rate counter
trans-unit.target: Frame rate counter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Composition (Render) Thread Frame Rate (FPS)
trans-unit.target: Composition (Render) Thread Frame Rate (FPS)

trans-unit.source: The rate at which the screen is updated.
trans-unit.target: The rate at which the screen is updated.

trans-unit.source: User Interface Thread Frame Rate (FPS)
trans-unit.target: User Interface Thread Frame Rate (FPS)

trans-unit.source: The rate at which the UI thread is running.
trans-unit.target: The rate at which the UI thread is running.

trans-unit.source: Texture Memory Usage
trans-unit.target: Texture Memory Usage

trans-unit.source: The video memory and system memory copies of textures being used in the app.
trans-unit.target: The video memory and system memory copies of textures being used in the app.

trans-unit.source: Surface Counter
trans-unit.target: Surface Counter

trans-unit.source: The number of explicit surfaces being passed to the GPU for processing.
trans-unit.target: The number of explicit surfaces being passed to the GPU for processing.

trans-unit.source: Intermediate Surface Counter
trans-unit.target: Intermediate Surface Counter

trans-unit.source: The number of implicit surfaces generated as a result of cached surfaces.
trans-unit.target: The number of implicit surfaces generated as a result of cached surfaces.

trans-unit.source: Screen Fill Rate Counter
trans-unit.target: Screen Fill Rate Counter

trans-unit.source: The number of pixels being painted per frame in terms of screens.
trans-unit.target: The number of pixels being painted per frame in terms of screens.

trans-unit.source: A value of 1 represents the number of pixels in the current screen resolution – for example, 480 x 800 pixels.
trans-unit.target: A value of 1 represents the number of pixels in the current screen resolution – for example, 480 x 800 pixels.

trans-unit.source: Enabling and disabling the frame rate counters
trans-unit.target: Enabling and disabling the frame rate counters

trans-unit.source: You can enable or disable the display of the frame rate counters in your code.
trans-unit.target: You can enable or disable the display of the frame rate counters in your code.

trans-unit.source: When you create a Windows Phone app project in Visual Studio, the following code to enable the frame rate counters is added by default in the file App.xaml.cs.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Windows Phone app project in Visual Studio, the following code to enable the frame rate counters is added by default in the file App.xaml.cs.

trans-unit.source: To disable the frame rate counters, set **EnableFrameRateCounter** to **false** or comment out the line of code.
trans-unit.target: To disable the frame rate counters, set **EnableFrameRateCounter** to **false** or comment out the line of code.

trans-unit.source: Known Issues
trans-unit.target: Known Issues

trans-unit.source: The following are known issues with the emulator, with suggested ways to work around problems if you encounter them.
trans-unit.target: The following are known issues with the emulator, with suggested ways to work around problems if you encounter them.

trans-unit.source: Error message: “Failed while removing virtual Ethernet switch”
trans-unit.target: Error message: “Failed while removing virtual Ethernet switch”

trans-unit.source: In certain situations, including after you update to a new Windows 10 flight, a virtual network switch associated with the emulator can get into a state where it can't be deleted through the user interface.
trans-unit.target: In certain situations, including after you update to a new Windows 10 flight, a virtual network switch associated with the emulator can get into a state where it can't be deleted through the user interface.

trans-unit.source: To recover from this situation run "netcfg -d" from an administrator command prompt: `C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft XDE\<version>\XdeCleanup.exe`.
trans-unit.target: To recover from this situation run "netcfg -d" from an administrator command prompt: `C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft XDE\<version>\XdeCleanup.exe`.

trans-unit.source: When the command is finished running, reboot your computer to complete the recovery process.
trans-unit.target: When the command is finished running, reboot your computer to complete the recovery process.

trans-unit.source: **Note** This command will delete all networking devices, not just those associated with the emulator.
trans-unit.target: **Note** This command will delete all networking devices, not just those associated with the emulator.

trans-unit.source: When your computer starts again, all hardware networking devices will be discovered automatically.
trans-unit.target: When your computer starts again, all hardware networking devices will be discovered automatically.

trans-unit.source: Unable to launch the emulators
trans-unit.target: Unable to launch the emulators

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Emulator includes XDECleanup.exe, a tool that deletes all VMs, diff disks, and emulator specific network switches, and it ships with the emulator (XDE) binaries already.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Emulator includes XDECleanup.exe, a tool that deletes all VMs, diff disks, and emulator specific network switches, and it ships with the emulator (XDE) binaries already.

trans-unit.source: You should use this tool to clean up emulator VMs if they get into a bad state.
trans-unit.target: You should use this tool to clean up emulator VMs if they get into a bad state.

trans-unit.source: Run the tool from an administrator command prompt:
trans-unit.target: Run the tool from an administrator command prompt:

trans-unit.source: **Note** XDECleanup.exe deletes all emulator specific Hyper-V VMs, and it also deletes any VM checkpoints or saved states.
trans-unit.target: **Note** XDECleanup.exe deletes all emulator specific Hyper-V VMs, and it also deletes any VM checkpoints or saved states.

trans-unit.source: Uninstall Windows 10 for Mobile Image
trans-unit.target: Uninstall Windows 10 for Mobile Image

trans-unit.source: When you install the emulator, a Windows 10 for Mobile VHD image is installed, which gets its own entry in the **Programs and Features** list in the Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: When you install the emulator, a Windows 10 for Mobile VHD image is installed, which gets its own entry in the **Programs and Features** list in the Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to uninstall the image, find **Windows 10 for Mobile Image - <version>** in the list of installed programs, right-click on it, and choose **Uninstall**.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to uninstall the image, find **Windows 10 for Mobile Image - <version>** in the list of installed programs, right-click on it, and choose **Uninstall**.

trans-unit.source: In the current release, you must then manually delete the VHD file for the emulator.
trans-unit.target: In the current release, you must then manually delete the VHD file for the emulator.

trans-unit.source: If you installed the emulator to the default path, the VHD file is at C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\Emulation\\Mobile\\<version>\\flash.vhd.
trans-unit.target: If you installed the emulator to the default path, the VHD file is at C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\Emulation\\Mobile\\<version>\\flash.vhd.
